attributes.action: Add the website of EFTA (European Free Trade Association) www.efta.int/ to the Commons and Lords Committees webpages links, involved with the EU (European Union)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Britain is involved with the EU, and is also a member of the EEA (European Economic Association). Other members of the EEA include Norway, Iceland and Lichtenstein. The current weblinks on the EU committees, only have links to the 25 EU members of the 28 EEA members. Adding the www.efta.int/ weblink will mean all countries that contribute to new regulations/laws and are involved with EEA matters will be represented in the weblinks. I feel this would have cross-party support.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
